results.title: The Pianist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Alain Sarde, Robert Benmussa and Studio Canal
results.brief_description: An epic but true tale of the pianist Wladyslaw Szpilman’s struggle as a Polish Jew to survive World War II. Based on a book by Szpilman, Ronald Harwood’s Academy Award winning screenplay covers the period of the second World War. Roman Polanski’s skill in motion picture storytelling is evident here as he is also a winner of the Academy Award for Best Director. The film received seven nominations in all, most notably the Best Actor Award going to Adrien Brody for his portrayal of Szpilman. A gifted composer and pianist, Szpilman was making regular appearances on Polish radio when the Nazis overran Warsaw. His family are taken to the walled Ghetto where Szpilman is able to make a meagre living by playing piano in a cafe where the more affluent and sometimes corrupt Jewish people dine. He narrowly escapes the fate of his family’s trip to the death camps and survives with the help of friends and his own instinct and just pure willpower. A sympathetic German officer who is moved by his talent also spares and sustains his life. A moving portrayal of the plight of Polish Jews but one which also shows that there are good and bad people on every side during times of war. Special edition two-disc set including a thirty-minute documentary on the making of the film. Other Awards include the Palme D’Or at Cannes 2002. Cast includes Thomas Kretschmann.

results.title: Thirteen conversations about one thing = 13 conversations ab
results.creator_credit: Jill Sprecher, Beni Atoori, Gina Resnick, Echo Lake Productions and Stonelock Pictures
results.brief_description: What is happiness? Through the journey of the everyday, five individuals’ lives link in a way that alters their fate or outlook. Karma, hope and fate are explored in this tale set in amongst busy city dwellers all with the need to answer life’s eternal questions of ‘what is life?’, ‘what’s in it for me?’ and even ‘how do I relate to others?’ Co-written and directed by Jill Sprecher. Stellar ensemble cast includes John Turturro, Matthew McConaughey, Clea DuVall, Amy Irving, Tia Texada, Barbara Sukowa, Alan Arkin.

results.title: Who knows? = Va Savoir
results.creator_credit: Jacques Rivette, Martine Marignac, Artificial Eye, Canal+ and Pierre Grise
results.brief_description: Urbane theatre is the setting for Jacques Rivette’s romantic comedy, revolving around the love affairs (past and present) of six individuals. When Camille returns to Paris to star in a new play she is reunited with a soon-to-be-married old flame; meanwhile her director/lover becomes intrigued by an ingenue who is assisting him locate a long-lost Italian play, whose brother is swindling a vulnerable woman. In this droll work, Rivette contentedly draws on the “life is art” theme, whilst the leisurely pace allows his protagonists to explore their entanglements with an appealing mix of contemplation and whimsy.

results.title: The Finished people
results.creator_credit: Khoa Do, Open Family Australia and Post 75 Productions
results.brief_description: A fine example of low budget filmmaking executed with a realistic fervour. Set in Sydney’s Cabramatta, three homeless youth struggle with the boredom, danger and many frustrations of life on the streets. Tommy (Jason McGoldrick) tries to overcome his drug addiction that started at a very young age. Van (Joe Le) sleeps in a car park but finds an unlikely camaraderie with a girl named Carla. Des (Rodney Anderson) gets involved with crims to try and etch out a living for himself and his pregnant girlfriend. Portrayed with a realism brought about by a young cast performing for film for the first time and based on a script written by those living a hard life, “The Finished People” provides a powerful insight into the world of homeless youth in suburban Australia. Although sometimes grim, moments of true human connection demonstrate that these young adults are not ‘Finished People’ at all.

results.title: Alexandra's project
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Julie Ryan, Fandango Australia, Palace Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: What strange and sometimes nasty things go on behind closed doors in suburbia is what this feature, written and directed by Rolf de Heer, is all about. An emotionally spent housewife Alexandra (Helen Buday) organises a birthday surprise for her husband and father of her two children. After enduring years of financial and emotional shutdown at the hands of her husband (Gary Sweet), Alexandra seeks revenge and sets about to undo her husband to the level at which she feels she has been wronged. Set for the most part within the four walls of the family home “Alexandra’s Project” is a tense, sexual and unsettling drama. Nominated for five Australian Film Institute Awards and three IF Awards. Contains sex scenes.

results.title: The Railway children. Swallows and amazons [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Claude Whatham, Lionel Jeffries, Richard Pilbrow, Robert Lynn and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: Set at the turn of the century, this is a story based on E. Nesbit’s novel, “The Railway Children”. It is much more than a happy-ever-after dream, evoking a nostalgia for a perfect world that exists only in our imaginations. Swallows and amazons: Arthur Ransome’s immortal story is the bright, breezy and colourful tale of six children on holiday in the Lake District during the glorious summer of 1929. As they happily mess around in boats, their friendly rivalry is filled with imaginary dangers and piracy. Based on one of the best loved books of all time, their exciting exploits are a handbook to adventure for children of all ages.

results.title: The Honourable Wally Norman
results.creator_credit: Ted Emery, Emile Sherman, Jonathan Shteinman, AFFC, Ocean Pictures, Showtime and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: From the world of politics a local hero emerges in the form of a ‘man of the people’ - Wally, Wally Norman (Kevin Harrington). Directed by Ted Emery (Kath & Kim) comes this comedy about the machinations of political life when a country town crucial for a win at the next federal election, finds itself with a dilemma. The local meat works is closed down and sleazy Ken Oath (Shaun Micallef) corrupt politician wants to win at any cost. Local man Wally Norman, unable to give speeches due to extreme fear, finally overcomes his inertia to lead the town he feels passionate about - Givens Head - and they elect their new leader. Set to the strains of Jimmy Barnes “Working Class Man”, this film pokes fun at politicians and is a cheer for the underdog. Opening night film for the Sydney Film Festival 2003. Cast includes Greig Pickhaver and Alan Cassell and was written by Andrew Jones and Rick Kalowski.

results.title: Travelling light. Parklands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Millard, Mandy Walker, Helen Bowden, Film Finance Corporation Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime Australia, Soft Fruit and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Travelling Light: Set in Adelaide in the 1970s comes writer/director Kathryn Millard’s debut feature film. Leanne Ferris (Pia Miranda) is supposed to be embracing her studies to become a teacher but is caught up in the social change and dynamism of the era when women and youth, in particular, were finding a new generation’s independence. The restrictive nature 1970s Australian society places on the married women in her life (Mum and elder sister Bronwyn) infuse Leanne with a drive to find her own path by becoming a photographer. Sexual forays, drug taking and poetry help shape Leanne’s young adulthood. Cast includes: Sacha Horler, Tim Draxl, Marshall Napier, Heather Mitchell, Simon Burke, Kestie Morassi, Tamblyn Lord. “Parklands” [307794]: Rosie (Cate Blanchett) is a young woman who returns to her home in Adelaide for her father’s (Tony Martin) funeral. This intriguing short film follows the path Rosie takes to solve the mystery of her father’s death. Talking with old friends, looking through diaries and photographs - reliving her childhood, she comes to understand the life of the man she called her father.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kathryn Millard, Mandy Walker, Helen Bowden, Film Finance Corporation Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime Australia, Soft Fruit and South Australian Film Corporation
results.description: Travelling Light: Set in Adelaide in the 1970s comes writer/director Kathryn Millard’s debut feature film. Leanne Ferris (Pia Miranda) is supposed to be embracing her studies to become a teacher but is caught up in the social change and dynamism of the era when women and youth, in particular, were finding a new generation’s independence. The restrictive nature 1970s Australian society places on the married women in her life (Mum and elder sister Bronwyn) infuse Leanne with a drive to find her own path by becoming a photographer. Sexual forays, drug taking and poetry help shape Leanne’s young adulthood. Cast includes: Sacha Horler, Tim Draxl, Marshall Napier, Heather Mitchell, Simon Burke, Kestie Morassi, Tamblyn Lord. “Parklands” [307794]: Rosie (Cate Blanchett) is a young woman who returns to her home in Adelaide for her father’s (Tony Martin) funeral. This intriguing short film follows the path Rosie takes to solve the mystery of her father’s death. Talking with old friends, looking through diaries and photographs - reliving her childhood, she comes to understand the life of the man she called her father.

results.title: Together [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Chen Kaige, Chen Hong, Lee Joo-ik, 21st Century Hero Film Investment, Big Bang Creative and China Film Group Corporation
results.brief_description: Returning to his native China, after the risible reception for his first English language feature, “Killing me softly” Chen Kaige treads on safe ground with this coming of age tale about a prodigious twelve-year-old violinist. Xiao Chun travels to Beijing seeking a place at a prestigious music academy, but after losing (unfairly, as it turns out, due to a lack of connections and payola), Xiao Chun’s father seeks private tuition with a cynical teacher fallen on hard times. Thus starts the journey of Xiao Chun into manhood; his talent grows as does his distraction for a flirtatious, (yet tender), prostitute who lives nearby. Introduced to the notions of love, honesty, deception and betrayal, Xiao Chun must soon choose between his gauche but loving country-bumpkin father and a cultured but soulless life in the city. Also available on VHS [318952].

results.title: Lilya 4-ever = Lilya forever [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lukas Moodysson, Lars Jonsson, Memfis and Zentropa
results.brief_description: Lukas Moodyson (Show me love, Together) delivers a bleak and melancholic story of a young Russian girl Lilya (Oksana Akinshina) who is abandoned by her mother (absconding to America with a boyfriend), deceived by her aunt and guardian and then betrayed by a friend who ruins Lilya’s reputation and consequently, her life. By a series of misunderstandings Lilya falls into prostitution and is then duped by an older man into believing a new life awaits her in the West. Once there however Lilya is forced into an array of humiliating and degrading circumstances that drive her to the brink. Set in the former Soviet Union, this is a somewhat desolate tale of dehumanisation, which contrasts starkly to the sunniness and humour of Moodyson’s “Together”, drawing on the grave themes of parent abandonment, child prostitution and human trafficking. Also available on VHS [318953].
